title: India says new EV policy will open up market to global players
summary: India's government expresses confidence that its newly introduced electric vehicle policy will attract international manufacturers and increase market competition. The announcement comes as part of India's broader push to expand its EV sector.
content:
India's Department of Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade has expressed confidence that the country's new electric vehicle policy measures will successfully attract more global players to its automotive market.

The government's recent policy rollout aims to create a more conducive environment for international EV manufacturers looking to establish operations in India. The initiative is part of a broader strategy to accelerate India's transition to electric mobility and reduce dependence on fossil fuels.

The policy framework is expected to streamline regulations, offer incentives to manufacturers, and create a more competitive market environment for both domestic and international players in the EV sector.

## Policy Outlook
India's Department of Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade has expressed confidence that the country's new electric vehicle policy measures will successfully attract more global players to its automotive market.

The government's recent policy rollout aims to create a more conducive environment for international EV manufacturers looking to establish operations in India. The initiative is part of a broader strategy to accelerate India's transition to electric mobility and reduce dependence on fossil fuels.

The policy framework is expected to:
* Streamline regulations
* Offer incentives to manufacturers
* Create a more competitive market environment for both domestic and international players in the EV sector
